nav.div: Lafayette County School District » News » What's New » Covid-19 Coronavirus Updates and Information

span.strong: The rest of the 2019-2020 School Year

br.span: This page will be updated as information is released by the LCSD administration.

strong.style: font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(192, 0, 0); font-size: medium;

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
p.span: April 14, 2020, 3:00 PM. During a press conference today, Governor Tate Reeves mandated that school buildings remain closed for the remainder of the semester. This does not suspend the rest of the term. LCSD will continue with distance learning and requirements to finish out the school year. Meals will also continue to be provided to our students at the pick-up locations.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px 0px; display: inline; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
p.span: We will provide you with more information soon regarding grade promotions and graduation. Continue to follow our website and social media accounts for more information.

strong.style: font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(192, 0, 0); font-size: medium;

span.br: The resources provided by the MS Dept. of Education for supplemental home learning is now added to our resources tab. Click here for access.

strong.style: color: rgb(192, 0, 0); font-family: Tahoma; font-size: medium;

br.span: See the instructions for the resources available on our distance learning portal and instructions to get hard-copy materials if needed.
The LCSD distance learning portal is now active. Visit the home page for access.

As per the mandate of Governor Tate Reeves, Lafayette County schools will remain closed until April 17, 2020. In response, the Mississippi Board of Education moved to cancel state testing for this school year.
Decisions are being made daily, and even hourly. We continue to stay anchored to serving our students and community.
We are working on plans to move forward with your child's education and will be providing information soon. Teachers are beginning to reach out to gather more information, please respond as soon as possible.
Your safety and your child's education and well-being is our top priority. Please know that we miss them and will continue to work hard for them in the coming days. Stay safe and stay "Anchored to Excellence."

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);
text-decoration-line: underline; font-family: latobold; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(192, 0, 0);

br.style: color: rgb(192, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;
color: rgb(192, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

strong.span: Lafayette County Schools will remain closed March 23-27th, 2020.
We will continue to provide you with more updates throughout the days to come.

div.span: The original date for Prom 2020 of March 28, 2020, has been moved out to May 2, 2020. This could change depending on where things go with the pandemic.

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Tahoma;

p.span: Oxford School District will be providing food pick up locations for ALL students. Due to this being a U.S. Dept. of Agriculture program, Lafayette County School students and families can also get a meal at these locations. Adults may purchase meals. Starts Tuesday, March 17th.

li.style: color: rgb(79, 79, 79); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
li.span: Tuesday, March 17 through Friday, March 27, OSD will provide free meals on weekdays from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. for ALL children (18 years of age and under). Adults can also purchase meals for $2 at these locations.

li.style: color: rgb(79, 79, 79); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

ul.li: Students do not need to enter a building for pick-up. Families should look for an OSD school bus in the parking lot at each location. Meals will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. Because this is a U.S. Department of Agriculture program, Lafayette County School students and families may also take advantage of these nutritious meals.

li.style: color: rgb(79, 79, 79); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

ul.li: Meal Pick-Up Sites* from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m.:

p.span: Wayne Johnson Apartments (900 Molly Barr Road)

em.style: color: rgb(79, 79, 79); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;

li.style: color: rgb(79, 79, 79); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

li.span: Mid South Mobile Food Bank truck

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;

span.span: will be set up at the new

background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;

span.span: 70 F.D. Buddy E Pkwy, Oxford, on

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;
background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px;

span.span: They will serve the first 500 families so getting there early will be beneficial.

br.strong: Effective immediately, March 16, all MHSAA interscholastic sports and fine-arts activities competition and practice is suspended through March 29 and until further notice. This suspension applies whether or not a school is open or closed during this timeline."

br.span: Updates to the Home Learning Resources and a message from Mayor Robyn Tannehill.
As per the recommendation of Gov. Tate Reeves, Lafayette County Schools will remain closed March 16-20th, 2020.
We will continue to provide you with more updates throughout the week.

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.span: The Lafayette County School District is canceling school, all sports, and extracurricular activities on Monday, March 16th and Tuesday, March 17th. District and School Administrators are monitoring the current information from the Mississippi Department of Education, the Mississippi State Department of Health, and the Governor’s Office regarding COVID-19. This is a fluid situation and further decisions will be made regarding additional necessary precautions.

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

div.span: The meals will include breakfast and lunch. Any child ages (1-18) may get meals. Meals will not be for sale and are only available for children.

span.style: font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
